question: Family elders are expressing disapproval of you to the rest of the family.  Do you:

answers.name: q201
answers.answer: Accept the criticism and change your ways?

answers.name: q201
answers.answer: Seek a compromise with them?

answers.name: q201
answers.answer: Besmirch the reputation of those expressing disapproval as you ignore their scorn?

answers.name: q201
answers.answer: Silence them any way you can?

question: Would you give up a promising career to aid the family in time of need?

answers.name: q202
answers.answer: In a heartbeat.

answers.name: q202
answers.answer: Yes, with some reluctance.

answers.name: q202
answers.answer: Only if I was certain I'd be able to return to my career soon.

answers.name: q202
answers.answer: No.

question: Would you betray a family member to advance your own career?

answers.name: q203
answers.answer: Yes, without a twinge of guilt.

answers.name: q203
answers.answer: Yes, if I could do it secretly.

answers.name: q203
answers.answer: I'd resist the temptation.

answers.name: q203
answers.answer: I find the very idea abhorrent.

question: Do you respect the leaders of your family?

answers.name: q204
answers.answer: Their words guide my actions.

answers.name: q204
answers.answer: They're role models for me.

answers.name: q204
answers.answer: They're often out of touch with my life.

answers.name: q204
answers.answer: They're out of touch with reality.

question: If your family had arranged your marriage to someone disgusting, would you:

answers.name: q205
answers.answer: Go through with it, proud to serve your family?

answers.name: q205
answers.answer: Agree, hiding your reluctance?

answers.name: q205
answers.answer: Subtly work against the union?

answers.name: q205
answers.answer: Flee?

question: You're estranged from a family member.  On his deathbed, he seeks reconciliation.  Do you:

answers.name: q206
answers.answer: Speak to him, but hold your ground?

answers.name: q206
answers.answer: Refuse to speak to him?

answers.name: q206
answers.answer: Discuss your estrangement openly and without rancor?

answers.name: q206
answers.answer: Actively seek reconciliation, and heed his dying words?

question: A powerful but corrupt lawyer offers you money if you'll testify against your friend.  Do you:

answers.name: q207
answers.answer: Condemn your friend and take the money?

answers.name: q207
answers.answer: Take the money and testify, but try to keep your testimony ineffective?

answers.name: q207
answers.answer: Refuse the offer and refuse to testify?

answers.name: q207
answers.answer: Testify on your friend's behalf, no matter the consequences?

question: Do you become close to friends, or hold most people at a safe distance?

answers.name: q208
answers.answer: I have an abundance of close friends.

answers.name: q208
answers.answer: I have some close friends.

answers.name: q208
answers.answer: I have few close friends.

answers.name: q208
answers.answer: I try to keep people at a distance.

question: Have you ever betrayed a friend?

answers.name: q209
answers.answer: I've done so more than once, and I sometimes get away with it.

answers.name: q209
answers.answer: I've done so once.

answers.name: q209
answers.answer: I've been tempted to do so, but I've never gone through with it.

answers.name: q209
answers.answer: I'd never contemplate such a thing.

question: How do you view lifelong commitment to a single romantic partner?

answers.name: q210
answers.answer: I have or want such a romance.

answers.name: q210
answers.answer: Such a romance would be ideal--if it's achievable.

answers.name: q210
answers.answer: I worry I'd miss out on what others have to offer.

answers.name: q210
answers.answer: Tie yourself to one person?  Huge mistake.

question: Do you insist on repayment when lending money to friends?

answers.name: q211
answers.answer: Yes, and I write up a contract so there's no misunderstanding.

answers.name: q211
answers.answer: Yes, but I try to be flexible about the exact terms.

answers.name: q211
answers.answer: No, although it's sure nice to be repaid.

answers.name: q211
answers.answer: No, they just owe me a favor.

question: Are you still in touch with childhood friends?

answers.name: q212
answers.answer: Yes, we correspond regularly.

answers.name: q212
answers.answer: Yes, we try to keep in touch.

answers.name: q212
answers.answer: No, I move around too much.

answers.name: q212
answers.answer: No, I don't have anything in common with them anymore.

question: Do you donate time and money to improve the local community?

answers.name: q213
answers.answer: Yes, the needs of the community are my top priority.

answers.name: q213
answers.answer: Yes, I donate as much as I can once my own needs are met.

answers.name: q213
answers.answer: No, I don't have enough time or money to spare.

answers.name: q213
answers.answer: No, my local community would be a waste of time and money.

question: The nation is at war.  Your community is threatened with invasion.  Do you:

answers.name: q214
answers.answer: Help defend it to your last breath?

answers.name: q214
answers.answer: Defend the area with the rest of your community?

answers.name: q214
answers.answer: Flee as soon as things look grim?

answers.name: q214
answers.answer: Cut a deal with the enemy to act as a spy?

question: If you were injured and required immediate assistance, would members of your home town agree to help?

answers.name: q215
answers.answer: Yes, because they know I'd do the same for them.

answers.name: q215
answers.answer: Yes, because I'm generally well liked in my home town.

answers.name: q215
answers.answer: Probably not, because I'm distrusted in my home town.

answers.name: q215
answers.answer: Definitely not, I've made some enemies in my home town.

question: Do you respect the laws and authorities of the community?

answers.name: q216
answers.answer: Yes, without question.

answers.name: q216
answers.answer: Yes, they're generally the best way to govern.

answers.name: q216
answers.answer: When it suits me--there are some laws I just don't agree with.

answers.name: q216
answers.answer: I don't pay attention to the authorities; they've got no hold on me.

question: Do members of your home town shun, avoid, or mock you?

answers.name: q217
answers.answer: Yes, their small minds can't handle anyone outside the norm.

answers.name: q217
answers.answer: Some do, because I don't always fit in.

answers.name: q217
answers.answer: No, I'm generally seen as normal.

answers.name: q217
answers.answer: No, I set the standard for what is normal in my community.

question: Would you stand for office or seek to represent the interests of the community in some public manner?

answers.name: q218
answers.answer: To do so would be an honor I'd joyously accept.

answers.name: q218
answers.answer: Of course.  It's everyone's duty to do so.

answers.name: q218
answers.answer: Only if no one else could handle the job.

answers.name: q218
answers.answer: No, I don't want to be responsible for the community's welfare.

question: Your country is wracked with famine.  Would you:

answers.name: q219
answers.answer: Share what food you had with others?

answers.name: q219
answers.answer: Eat as little as possible yourself, and share the rest?

answers.name: q219
answers.answer: Steal what food you needed to survive?

answers.name: q219
answers.answer: Steal as much food as possible, then sell it back to the community at a high price?

question: If offered enough money, would covertly assassinate the President?

answers.name: q220
answers.answer: Yes, I've done similar things before.

answers.name: q220
answers.answer: Yes, if I thought I could get away with it.

answers.name: q220
answers.answer: No, although a vast sum of money would tempt me.

answers.name: q220
answers.answer: No, and I'd warn the President of the plot.

question: A rogue state unleashes a laboratory-created disease on the nation.  Would you:

answers.name: q221
answers.answer: Undertake a dangerous mission to find the cure?

answers.name: q221
answers.answer: Heal the sick as best you can?

answers.name: q221
answers.answer: Avoid contact with the sick?

answers.name: q221
answers.answer: Flee the country?

question: Do you respect the lawful authority of the government?

answers.name: q222
answers.answer: Yes, I support the government wholeheartedly.

answers.name: q222
answers.answer: Yes, our leaders are generally fair and just.

answers.name: q222
answers.answer: No, a politician is no better than anyone else.

answers.name: q222
answers.answer: No, politicians are invariably corrupted by power.

question: If you were offered a reasonably lucrative deal, would you spy for a hostile foreign power?

answers.name: q223
answers.answer: Yes, because this nation could stand to be knocked down a peg.

answers.name: q223
answers.answer: Yes, because the nation's secrets mean little to me.

answers.name: q223
answers.answer: No, because I might get caught.

answers.name: q223
answers.answer: No, because I'd never violate the trust my nation puts in me.

question: Do you rely on the government to enforce contracts and property rights?

answers.name: q224
answers.answer: Yes, because maintaining the rule of law is more important than any individual dispute.

answers.name: q224
answers.answer: Yes, because the courts are best equipped to handle such disputes.

answers.name: q224
answers.answer: Are you kidding me?  The government can't even pave roads.

answers.name: q224
answers.answer: Absolutely not.  If I can't defend it myself, I don't deserve to have it.

question: If imprisoned, would you injure or kill others to escape?

answers.name: q225
answers.answer: Yes.  Serves 'em right for locking me up.

answers.name: q225
answers.answer: Yes.  They knew the risks when they took the job.

answers.name: q225
answers.answer: No, except for minor wounds that will heal easily.

answers.name: q225
answers.answer: No.  Those guards are just doing their jobs.

question: Is it a supervisor's right to treat his employees badly?

answers.name: q226
answers.answer: Yes.  The employees should be glad they have a job.

answers.name: q226
answers.answer: Yes, because sometimes only fear will motivate them.

answers.name: q226
answers.answer: No, supervisors should treat employees as kindly as possible.

answers.name: q226
answers.answer: No one has any 'right' to treat another badly at all.

question: You have accidentally hit someone while driving your car.  Do you:

answers.name: q227
answers.answer: Turn yourself in, and attempt to make restitution to the victim?

answers.name: q227
answers.answer: Turn yourself in, throwing yourself on the mercy of the court?

answers.name: q227
answers.answer: Hide your involvement, lying if you have to?

answers.name: q227
answers.answer: Try to pin the crime on another?

question: If guilty, would you confess to a crime?

answers.name: q228
answers.answer: Yes, because it is my duty to do so.

answers.name: q228
answers.answer: Yes, because it might get me a lighter sentence.

answers.name: q228
answers.answer: No, I'd make the court prove my guilt.

answers.name: q228
answers.answer: No, and I'd try to 'prove' my own innocence.

question: Would you express a revolutionary political opinion if threatened with punishment?

answers.name: q229
answers.answer: Yes, I'd rather be punished than remain silent.

answers.name: q229
answers.answer: Yes.  Somebody's got to speak the truth.

answers.name: q229
answers.answer: No, although I might privately express my opinion to friends.

answers.name: q229
answers.answer: No, politics aren't worth getting worked up about.

question: While traveling on vacation, you witness an assault.  You are ordered to testify, which will cut short your vacation significantly.  Do you:

answers.name: q230
answers.answer: Slip out of town at night to avoid testifying.

answers.name: q230
answers.answer: Deny you saw anything.

answers.name: q230
answers.answer: Remain reluctantly, testify, and leave.

answers.name: q230
answers.answer: Remain until the trial's conclusion in case further testimony is needed.

question: What is the best use of wealth?

answers.name: q231
answers.answer: To help the destitute and less fortunate.

answers.name: q231
answers.answer: Provide for the needs of friends and family.

answers.name: q231
answers.answer: To stay on top of the heap yourself.

answers.name: q231
answers.answer: To not only stay on top, but keep others from climbing to your level.

question: When confronted by beggars, do you:

answers.name: q232
answers.answer: Give generously?

answers.name: q232
answers.answer: Give moderately?

answers.name: q232
answers.answer: Give only what you wouldn't miss anyway--a dollar or two at the most?

answers.name: q232
answers.answer: Ignore them as you walk by?

question: If you could buy counterfeit one-hundred dollar bills for one dollar each, would you buy and spend them?

answers.name: q233
answers.answer: Yes, and I'll buy as much as I can.

answers.name: q233
answers.answer: Yes, but I'll only cheat huge companies who wouldn't miss it anyway.

answers.name: q233
answers.answer: No, it's too risky.

answers.name: q233
answers.answer: No, the business owners and employees have families to feed.

question: You have two job offers.  One pays more, but the other is secure and steady.  Which do you choose?

answers.name: q234
answers.answer: Definitely the lucrative job; steady work sounds like drudgery.

answers.name: q234
answers.answer: Probably the lucrative job, although I'd look into the secure job.

answers.name: q234
answers.answer: The secure job, unless the other job was outrageously lucrative.

answers.name: q234
answers.answer: Definitely the secure job, because I plan for the long term.

question: What's the best path to wealth?

answers.name: q235
answers.answer: It's a matter of luck and being in the right place at the right time.

answers.name: q235
answers.answer: Staying flexible so you can take advantage of good opportunities.

answers.name: q235
answers.answer: Following a long-term plan that incorporates a comfortable level of risk.

answers.name: q235
answers.answer: Hard work and perseverance.

question: If you accepted a job or contract, would you try to finish the task even if it got much more dangerous?

answers.name: q236
answers.answer: Yes, my word is my bond.

answers.name: q236
answers.answer: Yes, because it's good to have a reputation for dependability.

answers.name: q236
answers.answer: You can bet I'd be renegotiating.

answers.name: q236
answers.answer: If it's no longer a good deal, then the deal is off.
